reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Contribute towards achieving the targets of National Strategic Plan aligned with End TB Strategy for reducing the burden of TB and MDR-TB in Pakistan

description.narrative: Pakistan - Tuberculosis - Indus Hospital & Health Network - TIH. This program has the following goals: Contribute towards decreasing the prevalence, by at least 5% per year from 2018 onwards, the prevalence of MDR-TB among TB patients who have never received any TB treament.. Contribute to achieving the goal of the national strategy to control TB in Pakistan which is to reduce by 50% the prevalence of TB by 2025 in comparison to 2011.. The objectives of this program are: To enhance MDR-TB enrollment from 18% of estimated cases in 2013-14 to 23% of estimated by 2017. To increase TB case notification (all forms) from 61% of estimated incident cases in 2013-14 to 71% of estimated incident cases by 2017 while maintaining treatment success rate at 91%. To increase the number of TB patients who are screened for HIV infection from 3% in 2013-14 to 10% by 2017.

title.narrative: Percentage of notified TB cases, all forms, contributed by non-NTP providers - private/non-governmental facilities
TCP other 1: Number of cases notified through chest camps
Percentage of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB started on treatment for MDR-TB who were lost to follow up during the first six months of treatment
Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment
Number of notified TB cases (all forms) contributed by non-national TB program providers – private/non-governmental facilities
Percentage of bacteriologically confirmed TB cases successfully treated (cured plus completed treatment) among the bacteriologically confirmed TB cases registered during a specified period

Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases
TB other 1: Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified
Number of notified TB cases (all forms) contributed by non-national TB program providers – public sector
Percentage of new and relapse TB patients tested using WHO recommended rapid tests at the time of diagnosis
DOTS- other 1: Number of Cases notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed TB, new and relapses in private/ non governmental facilities
Proportion of facility reports received over the reports expected during the reporting period
Number of TB cases (all forms) notified among prisoners
